sentences.sentence: The Mice and the Weasels( 黄鼠狼 )
There was war between the mice and the weasels( 黄鼠狼 ).
The mice always lost, and many of them were killed and eaten by the weasels( 黄鼠狼 ).
They called a meeting.
In the meeting an old mouse got up and said,
“It's no wonder we are always beaten.
We have no generals( 将军 ) to plan our battles and direct our movements in the field.”
Following his advice, they chose the biggest mice to be their leaders.
These mice, in order to look different from the others, were given big helmets( 头盔 ).
They then led the mice out to battle, confident( 确信的 ) of victory.
However, they were beaten as usual, and were soon running as fast as they could to their holes.
All made their way to safety without difficulty except the leaders.
The leaders’ helmets( 头盔 ) were so big that they could not get into their holes, and were easily caught by the weasels( 黄鼠狼 ).
MORAL: Greatness carries its own danger.
The Miller( 磨坊主 ), His Son and Their Donkey( 驴 )
A miller( 磨坊主 ) and his son were walking their donkey( 驴 ) to a fair.
On the way, they met a group of girls.
“Look there!” cried one of them, “Did you ever see such fools( 笨蛋 ), walking on foot when they could be riding?”
The old man, hearing this, quietly told his son to get on the donkey( 驴 ), and walked along happily by his side.
Soon, they came to a group of old men talking.
“There!” said one of them, “It proves( 证明 ) what I was saying. What respect is shown to old age these days?
Do you see that young boy riding, while his old father has to walk?
Get down, you terrible boy, and let the old man rest his tired legs.”
The father then made his son get off the donkey( 驴 ), and he got on himself.
They hadn’t walked far when they met a group of women and children.
“You lazy old man!” cried several of them at once,
“How can you ride that animal, while that poor little boy can hardly keep pace( 保持同步 ) by the side of you?”
The good-natured miller( 磨坊主 ) immediately let his son get on behind him.
They had now almost reached the town when a man said to them, “Is that donkey( 驴 ) yours?”
“Yes,” said the old man.
“Oh! It’s hard to believe that by the way you load( 给...负重 ) him.
You should carry him, rather than him carrying you!”
“Anything to please you,” said the old man.
So, getting off with his son, they tied the donkey( 驴 )’s legs together.
Then using a stick, they carried him on their shoulders over a bridge.
The people ran out in crowds( 成群结队地 ) to laugh at( 嘲笑 ) the sight.
Finally, the donkey( 驴 ), not liking the noise or his situation, kicked, and fell off( 跌落 ) the stick into the river.
MORAL: You can't please everybody, and it’s foolish( 愚蠢的 ) to try.
The Mischievous( 惹事生非的 ) Dog
A dog used to run up quietly to the feet of people he met, and bite them without warning.
So his master( 主人 ) put a bell around his neck, to warn people he was coming,
and put a heavy chain( 锁链 ) around his neck to slow him down,
so that people would be able to get away from the dog.
The dog grew proud of his bell and chain( 锁链 ), and took them everywhere he went.
An old dog said to him, “Why do you walk so proudly? The bell and chain( 锁链 ) that you carry are not prizes.
They are a warning to others to stay away from you.”
MORAL: Those who get a bad reputation( 名声 ) often mistake it for fame( 名气 ).

question.cn: 在故事the Mice and the Weasels ，老鼠们开会之后是否胜利了？
question.en: In the story the Mice and the Weasels, did the mice win after the meeting?

analysis: 文中提到“However, they were beaten as usual, and were soon running as fast as they could to their holes.”可知，像以前一样，他们仍然失败了，因此选B。

question.cn: 在故事The Mice and the Weasels中，谁被黄鼠狼抓住了？
question.en: In the story the Mice and the Weasels, who were caught by the weasels?

analysis: 文中提到“The leaders’ helmets were so big that they could not get into their holes, and were easily caught by the weasels.”指挥的老鼠穿戴的盔甲阻碍了他们逃回洞中，因此选C。

question.cn: 在故事The Miller, His son and Their Donkey中，磨坊主是个怎样的人？
question.en: In the story the Miller, His son and Their Donkey, what kind of person was the miller?

options.en: He was easily affected by others.

analysis: 从文章中可以看出，磨坊主很在意别人的看法，经常因为别人的话而更改自己的行动，因此选B。

question.cn: 在故事The Miller, His son and Their Donkey中，最后驴怎么了？
question.en: At the end of the story the Miller, His Son and Their Donkey, what happened to the donkey?

options.en: The donkey was sold to the merchant.
The donkey fell into a river.

analysis: 文中提到“Finally, the donkey, not liking the noise or his situation, kicked, and fell off the stick into the river.”可知，驴最后掉进了河里面，因此选B。

question.cn: 在The Mischievous Dog故事中，为什么狗脖子上会挂一个铃铛？
question.en: In the story the Mischievous Dog, why did the dog have a bell around his neck?

analysis: 文中提到“A dog used to run up quietly to the feet of people he met, and bite them without warning. So his master put a bell around his neck, to warn people he was coming.”因为狗经常咬人，所以他的主人把一个铃铛绑到他脖子上来提醒别人，因此选B。
